name: Are you tasting your coffee?
description:
Immerse yourself in the world of specialty coffee with this workshop as you uncover the skills behind evaluating its flavours, mouthfeel, acidity, aromas and aftertaste. Coffee tasting is not just an essential skill for coffee experts; it's a gateway to unlocking a world of sensory experiences. 

This coffee tasting workshop is for everyone, whether you're a coffee enthusiast or simply curious about the intricacies of your favourite brew. By understanding the technical aspects of coffee tasting in this workshop, you'll elevate your coffee appreciation to new heights. Moreover, as you fine-tune your palate through this sensory exploration, you'll develop a heightened sense of taste that extends beyond coffee, enhancing your ability to savour and appreciate flavours in everything. 

Join us and discover the true essence of specialty coffee and much more! 

Workshop Highlights 

With this workshop: 
- Learn the basics of specialty coffee 
- Understand the coffee-tasting Indian Flavour Wheel 
- Distinguish between aromas, flavours and tasting notes of different coffees 
- Score specialty coffee

Date: 19th April 2025 (Saturday)
Time: 11 AM - 1 PM
Location: 

Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters, Salt Lake Sector 1

Please Note: Tickets for this event are non-refundable and cannot be transferred to future events.

name: Kerehaklu Estate - Washed
description:
A delicate and complex favourite, sourced from one of our longest-standing partners, has returned! We've roasted it light, so you can craft clean cups that really bring out the inherent flavour of the coffee beans.  

It opens with a sweet, honey-like aroma, easing you gently into the first sip. The soft, delicate body comes soon after, with the bright and citrusy mouthfeel delivering a pleasant punch. Expect low bitterness and medium-high acidity in your brew, and notes of peach, mosambi, and black tea, with the last one lingering a while. 

The perfect companion to moments of quiet, or pleasantly slow mornings, our roasters recommend brewing it black, either as a pour over, or using an AeroPress.

name: Seethargundu Estate
description:
We're thrilled to reintroduce a beloved favourite, Seethargundu Estate! 

Seethargundu Estate delights with a captivating flavour profile. The aroma combines the subtle hints of Jaggery and Sugarcane, adding a warm and inviting touch. Its citrus-infused aftertaste leaves a refreshing and lingering impression, providing a delightful complexity. This one is a must try for light and medium roast lovers, especially if you enjoyed our delicate coffees like Howdia Estate, Kerehaklu Estate - Weaver Washed and Unakki Estate.

Situated in the Nelliyampathy Hills region of the Western Ghats in Kerala, Seethargundu Estate is a Demeter-certified biodynamic estate.

Tasting Notes: Malta Orange, Sugarcane, Red Apple

Roast Level: Medium

name: Kerehaklu Estate - Peaberries
description:
This special two-pack(125 gms each), crafted in partnership with Kerehaklu Estate, features our favourite mutation, a Peaberry. Coffee cherries usually hold two seeds but about 5-10% of the time, just one seed grows inside the cherry. This is a Peaberry. Small, round, and denser than regular coffee beans, it boasts a unique flavour profile, with a deeper sweetness and a brighter acidity. 

Carefully isolated by Pranoy, Ajoy, and team at the farm, the Peaberries that lent to the creation of this pack were processed in two distinct ways: - 

Washed (Aerobic Sequential)  

This lot underwent a sequential aerobic fermentation, where Peaberries were submerged in water for an extended period, creating an oxygen-rich environment that brought out complexity, clarity, and bright acidity.  

Roasted light, these make for a cup with the aroma of brown sugar and citrus, and a juicy mouthfeel that opens into notes of mosambi, toffee, and green grape. The aftertaste is sweet and reminds of ripe mosambis.  

Natural (Anoxic) 

Fermented in an oxygen-free environment, the coffee cherries in this lot experienced a slower, more complex fermentation, since the microbes had more time to break down the sugars present, and produce a wider range of aromatic compounds. The result is a rich, fruity flavour profile with a deep body and balance.  

Roasted light, these make for a cup with the aroma of red grape and dark cherries, and a creamy mouthfeel revealing notes of orange, red grape, and red apple. Punctuating each sip is a lingering aftertaste of red apple.   

We recommend brewing these coffees black as a Pour Over or using an AeroPress.

Recommended Resting Period: 15 Days

Note: This coffee pack is a special release with limited availability and, therefore, cannot be included in our Mixed Bag subscription.

name: MSP Micro Lot Blend
description:
A melting pot of micro-climates where some of India’s finest coffee has thrived since 1920, MSP Coffee is a group of seven estates in Yercaud, including the three that lend to this blend. 

From achieving a surprisingly sweet cup after fermenting coffee with a local variety of bitter lemons to seeing the tail end of a 1000-hour ferment, the group exemplifies how curiosity lies at the heart of their work. The micro lots we picked for this blend come from Bison Valley Estate, Stanmore Estate, and Orchardale Estate and bear this very spirit. 

The first lot was washed and fermented with melon extract, with the processing imparting a unique sweetness. The second underwent triple fermentation: first as whole cherries, then after depulping, and finally after washing. This process uniquely combined quick dry fermentation and long anaerobic fermentation with watermelon, developing complexity. The third coffee was processed using the natural method, with cherries dried intact, allowing the fruit to shape its character. 

Roasted medium, the blend has a fruity and punchy flavour profile with notes of cherry, dark chocolate, and wild berry, followed by a rich, lingering aftertaste of chocolate. 

This blend works well black as well as with milk and lends itself nicely to most brewing methods including espresso, Pour Over, Moka Pot, French Press, AeroPress, and Cold Brew.

Recommended Resting Period: 7 Days

name: Attikan Estate
description:
Sweet with fruity overtones and balanced acidity, Attikan Estate is the darkest of our standard medium roasts and is perfect to brew an espresso with. It boasts of a bold and fruity profile, rounded off with a hint of nuttiness. 

  • Contains our most-loved and highest scoring coffees.
  • these coffee capsules are made using aluminium, that is 100% recyclable.
  • Keeps freshness and flavour intact.
  • Easy to use and perfect for quick, fuss-free brewing.
  • These coffee capsules are compatible with any machine that works with Nespresso®️* Original Line coffee pods.
  • We recommended using these for a single shot of espresso and espresso-style beverages.

Tastes great when consumed black or used in milk-based beverages.

name: Attikan Estate
description:
Attikan Estate's arabica coffee beans come from the Biligiriranga Hills in Karnataka and is make for one of our most popular coffees. Sweet with fruity overtones and balanced acidity, this is the darkest of our standard medium roasts and recommended for espresso lovers. It is a versatile coffee that also works for manual brewing such as Moka Pot, South Indian Filter and AeroPress. 

Located to the south of Mysore, the Biligiriranga Hills, or ‘white hills’ are named after the mist that hangs over the region. At 1650 meters, it is amongst the highest coffee growing regions in India and grows Selection 9, Selection 795, Cauvery and Kent varieties of Arabica, along with Silver Oaks, citrus, and fig trees.

name: Riverdale Estate - White Rose
description:
Fermented with rose petals, this layered light roast perfectly embodies why Riverdale Estate is a pioneer in experimental processing.  

Only the ripest cherries, hand-picked from the higher-altitude blocks of the farm, where the fruit matures slowly and develops an enhanced sweetness, were used. Once harvested, the cherries underwent a triple wash with natural spring water to remove impurities, followed by a floating process to eliminate underdeveloped beans.  

During fermentation, rose petals were introduced, setting up the stage for complexity in the cup. After fermentation, the cherries were slow-dried on raised beds for up to 30 days, allowing for even drying. Finally, the coffee was hulled at the estate’s dry mill, where any defective beans were eliminated before being sent to our roastery.  

In the cup, you’ll experience bright notes of blood orange, passion fruit, and pomegranate, complemented by a creamy mouthfeel and a lingering sweetness.  

We recommend brewing it black using an AeroPress or as a Pour Over.

Note: This coffee is a special release with limited availability and, therefore, cannot be included in our Mixed Bag subscription.

name: Raxidi Estate - Natural
description:
Our partnership with Raxidi Estate, a coffee farm run by three generations of the Lobo family since the 1950s, begins with an experimental anaerobic natural. 

To shape this micro lot into a cup with remarkable depth, handpicked coffee cherries were washed and placed in stainless steel containers, where they underwent a 20-hour anaerobic fermentation. Once fermented, the cherries were carefully dried on raised beds for 21 days, with temperature and humidity carefully monitored. 

Roasted light, the resulting brew opens with the aroma of prunes and black raisin, and notes of plum, raspberry, and mosambi. The mouthfeel is smooth and syrupy with a medium body, and finishing each sip is the sweet aftertaste of plum.  

Best enjoyed black, we recommend brewing this coffee using an AeroPress, or as a Pour Over.

name: Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters Gift Card
description:
Give the gift of great coffee with the Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters Gift Card! Whether it's a birthday, anniversary, or just a thoughtful gesture, this digital gift card is perfect for any coffee enthusiast.

Key Features:

  • Flexibility: Redeemable on all products at Blue Tokai, including freshly roasted coffee beans, brewing equipment, merchandise, and more.
  • Customizable Amounts: Available in various denominations to suit your gifting needs.
  • Hassle-Free: Delivered instantly via email, ready to use at checkout.

Why Choose Blue Tokai?

Blue Tokai is India’s leading specialty coffee brand, offering the finest beans sourced directly from sustainable farms. With a range of single-origin coffees and blends, the recipient is sure to find their perfect brew.

Surprise your loved ones with the gift of premium coffee today!

Terms and conditions 

  • Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters(BTCR) GIFT CARD is issued to be redeemed at BTCR App and Website.
  • BTCR GIFT CARD will be valid for 1-year to redeem from date of purchase.
  • The amount in BTCR can be redeemed on all types of orders on BTCR app and website.
  • The amount cannot be taken out/transferred from BTCR Wallet.
  • Use of BTCR Wallet will be subject to terms and conditions available at https://cdn.razorpay.com/static/assets/wallet/tncs.pdf
  • The amount can be used on multiple transactions on BTCR app and website.
  • No returns and no refunds on gift cards, e-gift cards and gift vouchers.
  • A GIFT CARD can be redeemed multiple times.
  • No cash payment will be made by the company for the Gift card either in part or in full nor exchanged.
  • In case the value of the service exceeds the value of the Gift card, the difference must be paid by other available payment modes.
  • No cancellation and No refund money are allowed on the issued Gift card.
  • Any unspent amount available in the Gift Card after the card expires shall stand forfeited.
  • BTCR does not accept any responsibility if the customer loses/misplaces the gift card. No duplicate card will be issued either.
  • E-Gift Cards are normally delivered instantly. But sometimes due to system issues, the delivery can be delayed up-to 24 - 48 hours. For enquiries or complaints email at getcoffee@bluetokaicoffee.com.

Steps to Redeem

App

  • Access Blue Tokai Coffee Roasters(BTCR) Wallet from the account section in BTCR App
  • You will then land on the BTCR wallet tab. Click on “Redeem Gift Card” button.
  • Enter your 10-digit gift card number and 4-digit PIN, press “Redeem”.
  • BTCR validates the code and adds the denomination to your BTCR wallet account.

Website

  • Enter your 10-digit gift card number and 4-digit PIN, press “Redeem” at the checkout page.
  • Enter amount fully or partially to redeem from the GIFT CARD.

Expiry

  • One year from date of purchase.

name: Salawara Estate - Lot 1418
description:
From a partner farm that prides itself on sustainable irrigation practices, and whose name translates to "a string of blessings", here's a versatile coffee with a balanced flavour profile. 

Processed using the honey sun-dried method, this medium roast has an aroma that hints at berries and honey. The lush, creamy mouthfeel reveals notes of peach, pomelo, and honey, while a light aftertaste of mosambi lingers. 

With low bitterness and a harmonious balance of sweetness and acidity, it makes for a great cup for diverse palates. Our roasters recommend brewing it as an espresso, a Pour Over, or using an AeroPress. 

It works well black as well as in milk-based recipes.

name: Wine Barrel Aged Coffee
description:
Meet our three-pack of wine barrel aged coffees, beautifully merging the world of fine wine and specialty coffee.  

Green coffee beans sourced from Baarbara Estate were aged for seven weeks in Fratelli wine barrels that had previously held three of their exceptional wines. The barrels were rotated every 5 days to ensure even infusion, and samples were drawn regularly to track the beans’ flavour development. After ageing, the beans rested for 10-15 days in our warehouses and were then roasted to a medium profile.  

From this process, three distinct, layered, and comforting coffees have emerged. Named after the wines previously stored in the barrels used during processing, the coffees in this selection are:  

  • MS Late Harvest treats you to notes of black cherry, prune, and red wine. 
  • Sette Collection brews cups with notes of red grape, orange, and walnut. 
  • J'Noon White tastes of sparkling wine, stone fruits, and raspberry. 

We recommend brewing this selection black.  

Note: The wine-like tasting notes in these coffees are a result of their unique processing. All offerings in this pack are non-alcoholic.

name: Dhak Blend 250g + Channi
description:
Rich Dark Chocolate, Cocoa, and Fruit Jam Notes: This dark roast offers a bold, layered profile with deep dark chocolate and cocoa flavours, complemented by a hint of fruit jam for a unique, indulgent taste. 

Best Enjoyed with Milk: Perfectly balanced and smooth with milk, this coffee creates a full-bodied, creamy cup that’s satisfying and rich. 

Includes a Stainless-Steel Channi: This combo comes with a stainless steel channi (filter), making it easy to brew a smooth, grit-free cup at home—ideal for coffee lovers and as a thoughtful gift option. 

Versatile Brewing Options—Channi-Friendly for Effortless Brewing: The Dhak Blend is recommended for espresso-based drinks as well as manual methods like Moka Pot and French Press. With the channi, you can also enjoy a well-filtered, bold cup quickly and easily. 

Description: Indulge in the rich, bold flavours of our Dhak Blend, where dark chocolate, cocoa, and a touch of fruit jam come together to create a memorable coffee experience. Ideal for espresso and manual brews, this dark roast can also be easily prepared with the channi, delivering a smooth, satisfying cup every time.

name: Riverdale Estate – Gesha Natural
description:
We’re excited to bring back Nano-X, our series of experiments created by a handful of visionary producers and creative Blue Tokai roasters, with the prized Gesha from Riverdale Estate.  

The Gesha variety is considered among the most sought-after, most expensive, and highest-scoring coffees which tend to score 90 points and above, in any part of the world. It originally hails from Ethiopia’s Gori Gesha Forest and was responsible for completely changing the world’s coffee landscape.  

Geshas are very hard to come across, and since last year, Prakashan and his team have been among the few ensuring a homegrown Gesha flourishes at Riverdale Estate. The coffee cherries he and his team harvested this year were processed by performing carbonic maceration in barrels, an experimental processing technique in which ripe coffee cherries are fermented in a CO2-rich, anaerobic environment.

Roasted light, the result is an exceptional lot, with the pleasant aroma of jasmine and oranges, and a multitude of delicate floral and fruity notes that evolve as the brew cools. 

Tasting Notes: Cantaloupe, Pomegranate, Bergamot, Jasmine

Roast Level: Light

About the Farm and Producer 

Nestled in the Shevaroy Hills of Tamil Nadu, Riverdale Estate has been managed by three generations since 1920. Its producer, Prakashan Balaraman, is one of the front-runners for experimental processing in India and he believes that the secret to good coffee begins with the crop. He’s been challenging traditional growing and processing practices and has previously processed coffees for us where interesting elements like papaya, pineapple and champagne yeast were used.

About the Roaster 

Our roasting team was very excited to work with a Gesha for the 2nd year, and one of our seasoned roasters, Shreyas, fine-tuned its roast profile. He appreciates how it makes for a clean, complex cup with a bouquet of delicate fruity notes, with floral notes standing out. 

Please Note: This is a special release available in limited quantities. Due to the exclusive nature of this coffee, no replacements or refunds will be offered. Every batch has been carefully cupped and approved by our expert roasters to ensure the highest quality. We recommend enjoying this coffee between 20 and 30 days post-roast, ideally after two weeks, for the best flavor experience.

name: Silver Oak Blend
description:
This medium roast is our signature house blend and is used to brew espresso-based coffees across our cafés. The Silver Oak Blend is an extremely versatile choice that has a balanced flavour profile and works really well as an espresso.

  • Contains some of our most-loved and highest scoring coffees.
  • Made using aluminium, that is 100% recyclable.
  • Keeps freshness and flavour intact.
  • Easy to use and perfect for quick, fuss-free brewing.
  • These coffee capsules are compatible with any machine that works with Nespresso®️* Original Line coffee pods.
  • We recommended using these for a single shot of espresso and espresso-style beverages.

Tastes great when consumed black or used in milk-based beverages.

name: Amaltas Blend
description:
An ode to the vibrant burst of yellow that marks the beginning of Indian summers, this blend is our go-to choice for crafting a refreshing batch of coffee including cold brews. In fact, this was originally called the Cold Bold Blend but owing to its diversity (its flavours shine through in a Pour Over or Aeropress), we decided to rename it after one of our favourite neighbourhood trees. 

A blend of washed and natural processed coffees, we’ve roasted it light to accentuate fruity and refreshing citrus notes. The result? Balanced cups with notes of blueberry and milk chocolate, with each sip concluding with a chocolatey finish.  

This light and fruity favourite is best enjoyed black.

name: Dhak Blend
description:
Our Dhak Blend is an ode to one of our favorite Indian trees with its colorful flame-like flowers that signal the onset of Spring. The coffees used in this blend are naturally processed which means that the coffee beans are dried with the cherry, resulting in complex, fruity and sweet flavours.

Roasted dark to bring out flavours of dark chocolate and fruit jam, this blend's heavy cocoa body leaves a smooth lingering aftertaste.

Our roasting team recommends the Dhak Blend for espresso-based drinks as well as manual brews such as the Moka Pot and the French Press.

name: Basankhan Estate
description:
We are thrilled to present our first ever single origin dark roast, with coffee beans sourced from a new partner farm— Estate in Chikmagalur, Karnataka. 

This coffee has a journey of rich, complex flavours that will leave you craving for more. As you take a sip, enjoy the velvety mouthfeel reminiscent of dark chocolate, which enhances the overall richness of this brew. The coffee’s body is heavy and round, creating a luscious and full-bodied experience that envelops your palate. If you’ve liked our dark roasts like Vienna and Dhak, you’ll love this one! 
The Basankhan Estate is a family-owned farm located in Chikmagalur, Karnataka with a rich history spanning over 100 years. In addition to coffee, the estate cultivates other crops such as black pepper, oranges, cardamom, lemons, and bananas.

name: Kolli Berri Estate
description:
Our first coffee from Harvest ‘24 is a medium-dark roast with chocolatey and nutty flavours. This single-origin ground coffee hails from the beautiful Kolli Berri Estate, set in Chikmagalur, Karnataka. 

While brewing this one, you’ll notice the unique characteristics of the coffee beans, starting with the aroma of dried fruits, followed by a syrupy mouthfeel in every sip. With medium acidity and medium- high bitterness, it offers a full-bodied profile which is enhanced when brewed as an espresso or using an AeroPress, Moka Pot or a French Press.

description:

Whether you're new to our brand or simply looking to diversify your coffee experience, this customisable mixed bag  is your gateway to discovering the ideal darker brews for your taste buds. 

Inside this carefully crafted sampler pack, you'll find three coffees: 

Vienna Roast: Rich and smoky notes with a perfect balance of boldness and smoothness.
French Roast: For those who crave the deep, dark intensity of a very dark roast. 
Silver Oak: Celebrated for its complex flavours and versatility, this one is our own in-house cafe blend 

Each Sampler Pack will contain 75 g x 3 pouches.

name: Sandalwood Estate
description: This perennial coffee from 2023's harvest, Sandalwood Estate, is delicious with tasting notes of rich dark chocolate, sweet prune and zesty orange marmalade. This washed coffee, with coffee beans of the Sarchimor variety, was grown at a lush coffee estate in Coorg. If you’ve tried our coffees from Attikan and Baarbara Estates, you’ll love the chocolatey flavour profile of this medium-dark roast. This heavy bodied coffee has a smooth, syrupy mouthfeel which can best be enjoyed when brewed as an Espresso, pour over or using an AeroPress, Moka Pot or French Press. The long, sweet aftertaste of butter biscuits and dried fruit come through beautifully when you allow the brew to cool down a little.

name: Thogarihunkal Estate
description: Start your day with the sweet aromas of toffee from our newest harvest from Thogarihunkal Estate. This delicious medium roast, with flavours of brown sugar, green grape and roasted almond, tastes great when taken black or with a little bit of milk. This coffee was processed using the washed method, developing the coffee beans to have a clean flavour profile with low acidity and bitterness, and a sweet, long aftertaste of honey and raisins. You can enjoy the smooth, buttery mouthfeel of this medium-bodied coffee by brewing it as an Espresso or a Pour Over, or by using other manual brewing methods.

description:

name: Silver Oak Cafe Blend
description: If our baristas have brewed you an espresso-based drink at any of our coffee shops, you’ll be familiar with this special offering since it’s our signature house blend! Our Silver Oak Cafe blend features a combination of Ground coffee beans, processed using either the washed or the unwashed method, to create and has a balanced profile that works well in espresso-based drinks as well as in manual brews such as AeroPress, Pour Over or in cold brews. This versatile medium roast is named after the Silver Oak trees commonly found across coffee plantations in Southern India. This offering is a small way of bringing our cafe experience to you.

name: Peacock and Bull Screen Print
description:
For all prints, 50% of the profit will go directly to the artist. Each print is created on A4 size card stock paper.

When we showed Mata ni Pachedi artist, Jagdish Chitara, our photos from the coffee farms, he told us that what struck him the most was the abundance of wildlife on the farms. Bison, peacocks, elephants, monkeys and a whole array of birds are just a few examples of species that consider these coffee farms to be their home. In India, unlike countries like Brazil, coffee is shade grown and bird friendly which means that coffee shrubs grow protected under the shade of older and larger trees which also offer a natural habitat to a number of animals including birds. 

Jagdish created two images that highlighted the natural wildlife that is found on coffee farms - the Cow and the Peacock, and The Elephant and the Boar.

About this print: This image depicts the numerous stories we heard of wild elephants on nearly every farm we visited. In fact, people living on most of these farms had a very early curfew so not to interfere with the movement of wild elephants as a sign of respect for the wildlife in their area (and also, we're supposing, to stay safe!). In this image, Jagdish recreates the notion of the commanding elephant and ubiquitous boar.
